about_me.a: I'm Pete a Design Engineer, or as I like to consider myself, an Holistic Designer.
I've been a designer for about 10 years, before that I was a chef and yet I still manage to burn my toast in the mornings.

I have a decade of experience in product design, working with startups, agencies and established companies to build and scale user-focused applications. My background spans traditional visual design, research, full-stack development, and automation.

Graphic Design, Motion Design, Interaction Design, User Experience Design, UI Design, Branding, Illustration, Design Systems, Generative Coding, Qualitative Research, Quantitative Research, Product Strategy, Market Research, Project Management, Frontend Development, Backend Development, A little DevOps, and Agentic Automation.

I don't specialize in areas like hardware design, industrial design, or any form of design that doesn't involve user interaction or digital products. I also don't work with top down companies, juggle or breakdance.

I don't specialize in areas like hardware design, industrial design, or any form of design that doesn't involve user interaction or digital products. I also don't work with top down companies, juggle or breakdance.
I work best with small empowered teams with a multi-disciplinary approach, where everyone understands at least some of what the others do and how they do it.

Yes, I enjoy mentoring junior designers and helping them grow in their careers. I believe in sharing knowledge and fostering a collaborative learning environment. If your interested reach out to me on LinkedIn.
Yes, I've been attending hackathons annually for over ten years and regularly give talks at design and tech conferences. I usually ramble and talk about failings rather than successes.
I'm based in Madrid and work with clients globally. I'm comfortable with remote collaboration or being onsite and have experience working across different time zones teams.

about_me.q: Why do you do what you do?
about_me.a: I have disabled parents so grew up surrounded by things that worked and behaved differently in order to make life easier for them. This sparked my passion for creating accessible, user-friendly products that solve real problems.

about_me.q: Do you have any principles or values?
about_me.a: I believe the ultimate goal of creation is to improve our collective experience. This is primarily done by reducing existential anxiety, being empathetic and yet, being pragmatic about the steps it takes to acheive this.

about_me.q: Do you have any strong opinions?
about_me.a: Many. mainly at the moment I think the social order is collapsing, too many people do not understand how technology works and soup is not a meal.

about_me.q: if you could ask me anything, what would it be?
about_me.a: Where does a sandwhich end and a burger begin?
I am a huge nerd, I love reading science fiction, ceramics, painting and testing new technologies.

about_me.q: What is your favourite thing to do?
about_me.a: I genuinely enjoy watching paint dry. I find it fascinating how the pigments interact and change as they dry, creating unique textures and colors. It's a meditative process that allows me to appreciate the beauty of impermanence.

about_me.a: Email me or hit me up on LinkedIn. I don't biteâ€¦

I aim to continue growing as a designer and engineer, exploring new technologies like AI and machine learning.

technical_skills.q: What technologies do you specialize in?
technical_skills.a: My core stack includes Svelte/SvelteKit, TypeScript, Node.js, PostgreSQL, and Semantic CSS. I also work extensively with React, Next.js, and various cloud platforms like Vercel and Supabase. I'm also familiar with SwiftUI for iOS development.
Yes! While I specialize in Svelte, I'm very proficient with React and Next.js. I've built numerous production applications using React but find the packages a little tedious.
I work with Node.js, Express, and various databases including PostgreSQL. I'm experienced with API design, authentication systems, and enjoy system architecture.

technical_skills.q: Do you have experience with databases?
technical_skills.a: Yes, I work with both SQL and SQLite databases. My primary experience is with PostgreSQL for relational data, I'm also semi-familiar with database optimization and query performance.
I deploy applications using Vercel or Hostinger. I'm familiar with CI/CD pipelines, and infrastructure as code.

experience.q: What kind of projects have you worked on?
experience.a: I've built everything from e-commerce platforms and SaaS applications to portfolio sites and data visualization tools. My projects range from MVP development for startups to enterprise-level applications.

Yes, I've worked in both small startup teams and larger development organizations. I'm experienced with most development methodologies, code reviews, and collaborative development workflows using Git and project management tools.

experience.q: Do you have experience with client work?
experience.a: I've worked directly with clients to understand requirements, provide technical guidance, and deliver solutions that meet business objectives. I prioritize clear communication and setting realistic expectations by focusing on clear problem definition.

portfolio.q: Can you show me some of your work?
portfolio.a: Poke around the site as this bot does not currently support content delivery. You will find examples that demonstrate different aspects of my skills, from complex projects to experiments.

Building a world-class Design System for a series C Scale up. It involved aligning multiple engineering teams distributed globally. A total rebrand as well as cross platform technologies for both web and native applications and a complete mess of a legacy codebase. It was a complex project that required deep collaboration and technical expertise.

availability.q: Are you available for new projects?
availability.a: I'm currently available for Q4 2025. I take on one project at a time to ensure quality delivery and proper attention to each client.

availability.q: Do you work on long-term contracts?
availability.a: Yes, I'm open to both project-based work and longer-term engagements. I've successfully worked on retainer arrangements and ongoing development partnerships.

contact.q: How can I get in touch?
contact.a: You can reach me through the contact form on this site, or email me directly at abbottsayshi@gmail.com. I typically respond within 4 hours and am happy to discuss potential projects or collaborations.

contact.q: What's the best way to start a project with you?
contact.a: I believe in a candid and casual approach to business relationships. We can have a quick chat online or over the phone to see if there is a fit then go from there. Alternatively, if you're certain you want to work with me I'm happy to produce a proposal based on your requirements.
Yes, I offer initial consultations to discuss project feasibility, technology choices, and strategic direction. The first consultation is complimentary.
